item.title: IHG Pet Policy Guide: Why Kimpton Is the Best Chain for Large Dogs
item.description:
If you’ve been following along, you know I’m obsessed with Hilton for dog travel. But here’s the thing: IHG has a secret weapon that even Hilton can’t match.

It’s called Kimpton.

Kimpton is hands-down the most dog-friendly hotel brand in existence. No weight limits. No breed restrictions. No pet fees. Ever. They’ll welcome your Great Dane the same way they’d welcome a Chihuahua.

But Kimpton is just one piece of the IHG puzzle. Let me break down the entire IHG portfolio so you know exactly where you can (and can’t) bring your dog.

The IHG Pet-Friendly Lineup

IHG has 20 hotel brands, but not all of them welcome dogs. Here’s what you need to know:

Tier 1: The Gold Standard

Kimpton Hotels â­ THE BEST

  • Weight limit: None (“If your pet fits through the door, we’ll welcome them in”)
  • Pet fee: $0
  • Breed restrictions: None
  • Number of pets: Unlimited
  • Pet types: Dogs, cats, birds, fish, even your pet lizard

Kimpton isn’t just pet-friendly â€” they’re pet-obsessed. Every property has a “Director of Pet Relations” (usually an adorable resident dog). They’ll greet your pet by name, provide beds and bowls, and even give you a list of nearby dog parks and pet-friendly restaurants.

The nightly wine hour? Your dog is invited.

Tier 2: Always Pet-Friendly (With Fees)

These brands welcome pets at ALL locations:

Staybridge Suites

  • Weight limit: 50 lbs (varies by property)
  • Pet fee: ~$75/week
  • Best for: Extended stays with a kitchen

Candlewood Suites

  • Weight limit: 80 lbs
  • Pet fee: $75 for 1-6 nights, $150 for 7+ nights
  • Best for: Budget-friendly extended stays

Both are extended-stay brands with full kitchens â€” perfect for longer trips when you want to cook for yourself (and your pup).

Tier 3: Often Pet-Friendly (Check First)

These brands have pet-friendly properties, but policies vary by location:

Hotel Indigo

  • Weight limit: 40-80 lbs (varies)
  • Pet fee: $50-$75 per stay
  • Vibe: Boutique, artsy, neighborhood-focused

InterContinental

  • Weight limit: Varies widely
  • Pet fee: Can be steep ($100-$250 in major cities)
  • Best for: Luxury stays when you can find a good deal

Crowne Plaza

  • Weight limit: Varies by property
  • Pet fee: Varies
  • Note: Not all locations are pet-friendly

Holiday Inn / Holiday Inn Express

  • Weight limit: Usually 40-50 lbs
  • Pet fee: $25-$75 per stay
  • Note: Very hit-or-miss â€” always call ahead

EVEN Hotels

  • Weight limit: Varies
  • Pet fee: Varies
  • Vibe: Wellness-focused, often in suburban areas

Tier 4: Usually NOT Pet-Friendly

  • Six Senses
  • Regent
  • Vignette Collection
  • HUALUXE

Why Kimpton Wins for Large Dogs

Let me be real: if you have a dog over 50 lbs, Kimpton is your only guaranteed option in the IHG family.

Here’s why this matters:

Brand 70-lb Dog Allowed?
Kimpton âœ… Yes, always
Candlewood Suites âœ… Yes (under 80 lbs)
Staybridge Suites âŒ No (50 lb limit)
Hotel Indigo âš ï¸ Maybe (check property)
Holiday Inn âŒ Usually no

Ansel weighs 70 lbs. At Kimpton, nobody blinks. At most other IHG brands, we’d be turned away.

How to Earn IHG Points for Free Stays

Here’s where it gets good. You can stay at Kimpton for free using IHG One Rewards points.

The IHG Credit Cards

IHG One Rewards Premier Credit Card ($99/year)

  • 140,000 bonus points after $3,000 spend
  • Free night certificate every year (up to 40,000 points value)
  • 4th night free on award stays
  • Automatic Platinum Elite status

IHG One Rewards Traveler Credit Card ($0/year)

  • 80,000 bonus points after $2,000 spend
  • No annual fee
  • Silver Elite status

Point Values

IHG points are worth about 0.5-0.6 cents each. A typical Kimpton redemption runs 30,000-60,000 points per night, though prices vary by date and location.

Pro tip: The 4th night free perk on the Premier card is huge. Book 4 nights and you essentially get 25% off your points redemption.

Transfer Partners

You can also transfer points to IHG from:

  • Chase Ultimate Rewards (1:1)
  • Bilt Rewards (1:1)

But honestly? IHG points aren’t the best use of Chase points. I’d rather transfer to Hyatt. The IHG credit card bonuses are usually the better path.

Kimpton vs. Hilton: Which Is Better for Dogs?

I get this question a lot. Here’s my honest take:

Factor Kimpton Hilton
Pet fees $0 $0-$75 (varies)
Weight limits None None (most brands)
Number of properties ~70 7,000+
Loyalty program IHG One Rewards Hilton Honors
Point value ~0.5Â¢ ~0.5Â¢
Best for Boutique experience, guaranteed pet-friendly More locations, easier to find availability

My verdict: Kimpton is technically more dog-friendly, but Hilton’s massive footprint makes it more practical for everyday travel. I use both.

If there’s a Kimpton where I’m going? I book it. If not? Hilton it is.

Tips for Booking Pet-Friendly IHG Stays

  1. Always call the property directly â€” Even “dog-friendly” hotels can have restrictions that aren’t listed online.

  2. Book Kimpton for guaranteed acceptance â€” Don’t risk showing up with your 70-lb dog only to be told there’s a 50-lb limit.

  3. Use the IHG app filter â€” Search for “Pet Friendly” under amenities, but verify the specific policy.

  4. Stack promotions â€” IHG frequently runs double/triple point promotions. Combine with credit card bonuses for maximum value.

  5. Consider extended-stay brands â€” Candlewood and Staybridge have kitchens, which is clutch for longer trips with dogs (no restaurant hunting!).

The Bottom Line

If you’re traveling with a large dog and want zero stress about pet policies, Kimpton is unbeatable. No weight limits, no fees, no judgment.

The trade-off? There are only about 70 Kimpton properties, mostly in major cities. You won’t find one in every small town.

For broader coverage, pair your IHG strategy with Hilton. Between the two programs, you’ll have pet-friendly options almost anywhere.

My recommendation:

  • Get the IHG Premier card for Kimpton stays ($99/year, free night certificate pays for itself)
  • Get the Hilton Surpass or Aspire for everywhere else
  • Never pay pet fees again

Have you stayed at a Kimpton with your dog? I’d love to hear about your experience â€” leave a pawprint and tell me which property!

item.title: Kimpton Pet Policy 2025: No Fees, No Weight Limits, No Restrictions
item.description:
If you’ve traveled with a dog â€” especially a big one â€” you know the frustration of weight limits, breed restrictions, and pet fees that cost as much as another night’s stay.

Kimpton doesn’t do any of that.

Kimpton’s pet policy is simple: if your pet fits through the door, they’re welcome. No weight limit. No breed restrictions. No pet fee. Ever.

Here’s everything you need to know about staying at Kimpton with your dog.

Disclosure: This post contains affiliate links. If you apply for a card through my links, I may earn a commission at no extra cost to you. See my full disclosure for details.

Jump to:

  • The Policy
  • What Makes Kimpton Different
  • Pet Amenities
  • Where to Find Kimptons
  • How to Book Free
  • FAQs

Kimpton’s Pet Policy: The Details

Policy Kimpton
Pet fee $0 (free)
Weight limit None
Breed restrictions None
Number of pets No limit
Pet types Dogs, cats, birds, fish, and more

That’s not a typo. Kimpton has no weight limit. They’ve welcomed Great Danes, Saint Bernards, and everything in between. Their unofficial motto is “if they fit through the door, they’re welcome.”

What Makes Kimpton Different

Kimpton didn’t just add “pet-friendly” to their website and call it a day. They built their entire brand around welcoming pets.

No Fees, Period

Most “pet-friendly” hotels charge $50â€“$150 per stay. Kimpton charges nothing. Stay a week with your dog and you’re saving $100+ compared to other chains.

No Weight Limits

This is the big one. Most hotels cap pets at 50â€“75 lbs. If you have a German Shepherd, Lab, Golden Retriever, or any other large breed, you’ve probably been turned away before.

At Kimpton, your 100-lb dog is just as welcome as a 10-lb dog. No awkward conversations at check-in. No hoping they don’t notice your dog is “a little over” the limit.

No Breed Restrictions

Pit bulls, Rottweilers, Dobermans, German Shepherds â€” breeds that some hotels ban entirely are welcome at Kimpton. They judge dogs by behavior, not breed.

It’s Not Just Tolerance â€” It’s Celebration

Many Kimpton properties have a Director of Pet Relations â€” yes, that’s a dog with an official title. They host pet-friendly events, keep treats at the front desk, and genuinely love seeing dogs in the lobby.

The nightly wine hour? Your dog is invited.

Pet Amenities at Kimpton

Kimpton doesn’t just allow pets â€” they roll out the red carpet:

  • Pet beds and bowls available on request (often in the room already)
  • Treats at check-in at most properties
  • Pet-friendly mini bar items at some locations
  • Local pet recommendations â€” dog parks, pet stores, vet clinics
  • Dog-walking services at select properties
  • Pet-sitting referrals if you need a night out

Some Kimptons even have dog-friendly restaurant patios on property where your pup can join you for dinner.

Kimpton Locations

Kimpton operates 77+ hotels in the U.S. plus a few international locations. They’re a boutique brand, so you won’t find one in every small town â€” but they’re well-represented in major cities and popular destinations.

Cities with Multiple Kimptons:

  • San Francisco (where Kimpton started)
  • New York City
  • Los Angeles
  • Chicago
  • Washington D.C.
  • Seattle
  • Denver
  • Austin
  • Miami / South Florida
  • Portland
  • Boston

Notable Dog-Friendly Kimptons:

Kimpton Hotel Monaco (Denver, Salt Lake City, Portland, others) Downtown locations with easy access to parks and trails. Known for particularly welcoming staff.

Kimpton Brice Hotel (Savannah) Enclosed courtyard perfect for the wine hour with your pup. Walking distance to Forsyth Park.

Kimpton Rowan (Palm Springs) Desert getaway with multiple dog parks nearby and pet-friendly restaurant patios everywhere.

Kimpton Arras (Asheville) Gateway to Blue Ridge Mountains hiking. Asheville is one of the most dog-friendly cities in the country.

Kimpton Journeyman (Milwaukee) Dedicated pet-friendly floors. Great urban location.

How to Book Kimpton Free with Points

Kimpton is part of IHG One Rewards (InterContinental Hotels Group). You can book free stays using IHG points.

Earning IHG Points

Option 1: IHG Credit Cards

Card Annual Fee Sign-Up Bonus Best For
IHG One Rewards Traveler $0 80,000 points No-risk starting point
IHG One Rewards Premier $99 140,000 points Regular Kimpton stays

The Premier card also gives you:

  • 4th night free on award stays â€” book 4 nights, pay for 3 with points
  • Free night certificate every year (up to 40,000 points value)
  • Platinum Elite status â€” room upgrades when available

Option 2: Transfer from Chase Ultimate Rewards

Chase points transfer 1:1 to IHG. If you have a Chase Sapphire Preferred or Reserve, you can move points to IHG when you find a Kimpton you want to book.

How Many Points for a Kimpton Stay?

Demand Points per Night
Off-peak 25,000â€“40,000
Standard 40,000â€“60,000
Peak 70,000â€“100,000+

Pro tip: The 4th night free benefit on the IHG Premier card is huge for Kimpton stays. A 4-night trip that would cost 200,000 points becomes 150,000 â€” that’s 25% off.

The trade-off: Kimpton has the best pet policy, but the smallest footprint. You won’t find a Kimpton in every city. For those destinations, Hilton or Marriott are solid backups.

My approach: Book Kimpton whenever there’s one where I’m going. Use Hilton for everywhere else.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Kimpton really free for pets?

Yes. No pet fee, no deposit, no hidden charges. This has been their policy since 1992 and they’ve never wavered.

What’s the actual weight limit?

There isn’t one. They’ve hosted Great Danes, Mastiffs, and Irish Wolfhounds. If your dog can walk through the door, they’re welcome.

Can I bring multiple pets?

Yes. Kimpton doesn’t limit the number of pets. Traveling with 3 dogs? Still welcome, still free.

What about cats, birds, or other pets?

Kimpton welcomes all pets â€” dogs, cats, birds, rabbits, fish, even monkeys (yes, really). They’re not dog-specific like some “pet-friendly” hotels.

Do I need to notify them in advance?

It’s courteous to mention you’re bringing a pet when booking, but it’s not required. You won’t be turned away for showing up with a dog.

Can my dog be alone in the room?

Kimpton allows pets to be left in the room as long as they’re comfortable and won’t disturb other guests. If your dog barks when alone, consider crating them or taking them with you.

Are there pet-friendly rooms vs. regular rooms?

No distinction. Every room at Kimpton is pet-friendly. You won’t be relegated to a ground-floor smoking room from 1987.

What if my dog damages something?

You’re responsible for any damage, same as any hotel. But Kimpton doesn’t require a pet deposit, which shows how confident they are in pet owners.

The Bottom Line

If you have a large dog, a “scary” breed, or you’re just tired of paying pet fees, Kimpton is the answer. No other major hotel chain comes close to their pet policy.

The only downside is their limited footprint â€” 77 hotels doesn’t compete with Hilton’s 7,000. But when there’s a Kimpton where you’re going, book it. Your dog will thank you.
